column3: WiNC Director of Events, UTSU Orientation Promotions Coordinator, Best Buddies Peer Buddy, BSA Dancer, UTSU Associate Vice-President Equity
column6: Women and Gender Studies and Equity Studies
column12: Increase networking opportunities for humanities students by hosting more career-building events.

column14: Advocate for more work-study opportunities for undergraduate humanities students.
column15:
Vote COMPASS!

I'm Ashmita Roy, and I'm running to represent Humanities students on the UTSU Board of Directors. Being a humanities student has made me realize we are often left to our own devices to find opportunities on campus. I plan to change that by creating a network where students can connect with one another and create opportunities that utilize our strengths. I want to make equity training and events more accessible with all I have learned as an Equity Studies student and as the Associate to the Vice-President Equity. Equity training informs the broader understanding of the humanities by tying abstract concepts with questions that arise on campus and beyond. If elected, I will seek to bridge the rift between all that humanities students offer and the practical applications of those skills on campus.
column16:
Vote COMPASS!

I'm Marawan Sadek and I'm running to represent Life Sciences students on the UTSU's Board of Directors. I have been a part of this university and program for two years now and I have benefited from all its privileges, but have also endured its many flaws and mishaps. My goal is to ensure that the Life Sciences department better meets student needs and provides the resources hard-working students need. I believe in the voice of the students, and I think that it's about time Life Sciences students are heard. I hope to unite both the Life Sciences community and bigger UofT community by making the communication between students, professors and faculty stronger and more valuable. Only through this unity can we optimise student experience and allow everyone to benefit from the various university resources available!
column16:
Vote COMPASS!

I’m Erwin-Jeffrey Komguem and I’m running to represent Statistics, Physics, Mathematics and Actuarial Science students on the UTSU Board of Directors. During my time at UofT, I have been heavily involved within the school community. Through interactions with a wide variety of students, I have been able to develop a strong understanding of how I can advocate for students in Physical & Mathematical Sciences for a better UofT experience. I plan to do this by providing students with accessible internship and mentorship opportunities, and more. Overall, I would like to work with the UTSU in order to make sure that Mathematics, Physics, Statistics and Actuarial Science students are well represented and that their voices are heard.

Vote COMPASS! 

I'm Mehwish Siddiqui and I'm running to represent all Rotman Commerce students on the UTSU Board of Directors. As a first year student, I took on several opportunities in my program to get involved and to grow and interact with the Rotman Commerce community. I am currently a first year intern in the Rotman Commerce Student Association and have taken part in the Events, Advocacy, and International Student Liaison portfolios. Within the Rotman Commerce community, I listen to and discuss the struggles and concerns we all share. Now, I want to take these discussions to the University of Toronto Students' Union in order to provide more resources to students in our program, and build a bridge between our program and University of Toronto as a whole. This includes discussions on our course requirements, percentages required to proceed to 2nd year, career opportunities, mental health resources, transporation and residential support, a student center for all Rotman Commerce students, and much more!
column16:
Vote COMPASS!

I'm Joshua Bowman and I'm running to represent Social Sciences students on the UTSU Board of Directors. Throughout my years at U of T, I have been privileged to have made so many meaningful connections that have not only informed my education but also my personal life. I understand that the students at U of T are far from average, and we should have a campus that does not inhibit but instead bolsters their potential. If elected, I will create an Indigenous breadth requirement; I will build bridges between courses that will inform interdisciplinary degrees; and most importantly, I will provide a platform for the student voices that I am proud to share this university with.
column16:
Vote COMPASS!

I'm Vitaly Topekha and I am running to represent Computer Science students on the UTSU Board of Directors. Coming into my fourth year at University of Toronto as an international student, I want to share what I wish I knew since my first year. There is a lot the University of Toronto has to offer its students, but most students aren't aware of the resources and opportunties that are available. I plan to give students the resources they need for learning outside of the classroom and help them pursue their passions, which could be starting a new start up, club, doing research in a field that they love, or getting the job they have always dreamed about.

column3: Innis College Council, Innis Residence Council
column12: Lobby the University administration and province to introduce a cap on deregulated tuition fees
column13: Ensure that Innis College has strong representation on the UTSU

column15:
Vote COMPASS! 

Hey everyone, my name is Lucas Granger and I am a second-year student running to represent you as your Innis College Director for the UTSU! I have been involved in various Innis related committees, such as the Innis College Council and various Residence Council activities. The Innis community has given me a lot of opportunities, and I want to give back. My primary goal is to ensure that as the only representative for Innis College that our voice is not drowned out or absent from any of the debates that may occur over the course of my term. In addition to this, I intend on lobbying the University administration to put a cap on deregulated tuition fees, as I feel that everyone should have access to an equal education. Lastly, since the vast majority of students live off campus, I plan to advocate for the needs of commuting students through lower costs of local transportation. Vote for a better direction for UofT, Vote COMPASS!
column16:
Vote COMPASS!

I am Usman Sadiq and I'm running to represent Victoria College on the UTSU Board of Directors. Going into my third year, I feel lucky to have been a part of our amazing Victoria College community. However, I feel that we, as students paying for the UTSU every year, do not have enough insight on what is actually happening and how we can contribute to it. I plan on bridging the gap between Victoria College and other colleges by organising inter-collegiate socials which ensure that we do not miss out on meeting some amazing people at our time at UofT. We, as a community, have to make sure we have the best college experience possible and it can certainly be done, so vote for Usman for a better UofT experience!

I am Haleema Khan and I am running to represent Victoria College on the UTSU Board of Directors. As an incoming third year student, I have immersed myself in the Victoria College community through my role as a Vic Tour Guide, a VUSAC Councillor, and through my experience living on residence. I have an immense amount of love and pride for Victoria College and I hope to serve as a liaison between Victoria College and the UTSU at large. By connecting with students directly, and voicing their needs on the UTSU, I plan to ensure all Vic students feel represented on the UTSU. Together let's make our experience at U of T a positive one. We KHAN do it!

column3: President of the University College Residence Council
column10: Biking, hiking, rock climbing, listening to music
column12: Lobby to introduce fair grade forgiveness policies
column13: Lobby the University administration and province to introduce a cap on deregulated tuition fees
column14: Bridge the gap between commuter and residence students
column15:
Go the right path, vote COMPASS! 

My name is Artur Khasanov and I am running for University College Director to represent UC on the UTSU Board of Directors. This is my third year at UC and my second year of involvement at an administration level. 

As the current University College Residence Council President, I have tackled many issues UC students face, but I want to go further by addressing them at a higher instance. I want to bridge the gap between commuters and residents as UC should be a united community. Therefore, I will do this by expanding UTSU events at UC to cover both groups of students. Additionally, I would like to lobby for UofT students to improve academic forgiveness and equalize tuition fees across all faculties.
 
Further involvements include my role in helping the UC Literature and Athletic Society with their events. These roles have prepared and motivated me to represent my college on a wider scale. As your UC representative, I believe I will have both the essential background and passion to make your dreams come true.
column16:

column14: nan
column15:
Vote COMPASS! 

I'm Sabrina Brathwaite and I'm running for one of the three University College Director positions. My platform consists of three main points; outreach, mental health, and integration of international students. What this means is that I would like to focus heavily on outreach and bridging the gap between student governmental bodies and the students themselves, who may want to make change on campus but don't know where to start. Additionally, I'm quite passionate about mental health outreach and de-stigmatizing mental illness. I hope to work on events and initiatives to help educate students about mental health while also de-mystifying lesser known mental illnesses. Finally, I know that it can be difficult coming to a new country with different customs and official languages that are foreign to you. I'd like to rethink the initiatives on campus that help international students acclimate to culture, language, and available resources.
column16:
Vote COMPASS!

Hi, I am Tajwar Arnab and I am running to represent the students of USMC on the UTSU Board of Directors next year. As a first year experiencing university life for the first time, I believe that we should be more actively involved on campus to make a difference in our everyday lives. We always strive for the best and continue to work towards it. I want to be able to create a more involved, inclusive and diverse engagement between SMC and the wider UofT community. As a first year, I know how hard it can be to fit in and to get involved in the community. I will make an active effort day in and day out to make sure everyone feels like they belong and that their voices are being heard.

I am Kate Strazds and I am running to represent USMC on the UTSU Board of Directors. Going into my fourth year, I feel lucky to have experienced the wonderful community that is USMC. Throughout my undergrad, my involvement at USMC, such as being the Vice-President of SMCSU, has shown me that there's still room for improvement at UofT. I would like to work with the UTSU and SMCSU to run education-based equity events and educational workshops that teach student leaders and students at USMC the importance of equity. Secondly, as a commuter I would like to work with SMCSU to create an inclusive space for commuter students who don't feel as if they're a part of the community. Finally, I would like to ensure that the services provided by the UTSU are accessible by USMC students.

I am Hamid Mohamed and I am running to represent the students of USMC on the UTSU Board of Directors. I'm deciding to run for the upcoming year because I believe that minor changes to the UTSU can go a long way not just for students today but also for future UofT students. I am aware that the position is a big responsibility, but it is one that I am willing to take on. Over my two years here, I've realized how challenging and stressful school can be, but it doesn't have to be that way. Together we can bring positive change to the UTSU. If elected, I promise to work in the best interest of USMC students and work towards an environment that is more equitable for everyone.

I'm Wendy Tu and I'm running to be your next Nursing Director. As a nursing student, I understand the barriers nursing students face in accessing U of T services, such as the Health and Wellness Centre. I want to advocate to extend the hours of operation of these services to better accommodate nursing students' schedules. I also want to strengthen the relationships between nursing students and students from other faculties to foster a more integrated student experience. I want to represent nursing students and make sure that their voices are heard and their needs are met!

I am Tiffany Tiu and I am running to be your Professional Faculties at large director! Being involved in student politics and being an active member in the Kinesiology and Physical Education Undergraduates’ Association, I have observed a couple of issues. Since Professional Faculties have their own policies and structure, it is not difficult for these faculties to be a bit detached from the services that UTSU provides. Therefore, I’d like to increase awareness of the UTSU and its services to ensure sufficient support and accessible services are provided to students in Professional Faculties. I am a student passionate about student rights in Professional Faculties -- vote Tiffany and COMPASS so we can work together to provide a wonderful year for you!

Hey SKULE, I'm Lisa Zaher and I am running to represent you as an Engineering Director on the UTSU Board of Directors. Through my involvement with EngSoc, I have become aware of the issues that engineering students are most passionate about, and I would love to be able to solve these problems and improve your experience at Skule with the UTSU. My priorities include advocating for better mental health services for engineering students, ensuring that UTSU services are accessible to engineers, and improving the quality of engineering student spaces.

column15:
Vote COMPASS!

Hey SKULE, I'm Matthew Kerner and I am running to be one of your Engineering Directors on the UTSU! As I enter my final year on campus, I feel lucky to have been part of so many facets of our Engineering community. Although their missions may vary, the events, clubs and design teams that call SKULE their home all play a role in making this faculty one of the most unique and defining parts of our school. Therefore, this coming school year, I will make certain that policies and services introduced by the UTSU push the development of our student-run teams further. I will ensure that students of today and tomorrow have even more outlets on campus to make their time at U of T the best it can be! This election, Count On Kerner and Vote Matthew for Engineering Director!

column12: Ensure reasonable and transparent use of UTSU fees for engineers.
column13: Help SKULE based clubs grow and succeed
column14: Make UTSU fee opt outs easily accessible
column15:
Vote COMPASS!  

Hey SKULE, I'm Joanna Zhou and I am running as an Engineering Director to speak up for us engineers. As a class representative in Engsci Club and active executive in IEEE, ACE, and UTCA, I am so lucky to have heard so many different voices and worked towards impactful solutions. From workshops to hackathons, Skule clubs deserve more funding to do more for students. From transit to healthcare, engineers deserve to know clearly what they've spent their money on and what they can do with the UTSU fees. Being a 2nd year Engsci myself, I've experienced times when I am simply too busy to catch up with all the details like UTSU fees refunding, dental service, and various surveys related to ourselves ---- I aim to make these things easier for you, my fellow engineers, to access and utilize your rights.

Vote COMPASS!
